text: Gateway Motorsports Park (now known as World Wide Technology Raceway) is a motorsport racing facility in Madison, Illinois, just east of St. Louis, close to the Gateway Arch. It has a oval that hosts the NASCAR Cup Series, NASCAR Xfinity Series, and the NTT IndyCar Series. St. Louis International Raceway was built in 1967 as a drag racing facility by Wayne and Ruth Meinert. ==References== Category:Buildings and structures in Illinois
title: Gateway Motorsports Park
